New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers became the fourth team to start 15-0, joining the Golden State Warriors (2016), Houston Rockets (1994), and Washington Capitols (1949).
Key Match Events: Ty Jerome matched his career-high with 24 points.
Evan Mobley had 23 points and 11 rebounds.
Jarrett Allen had 21 points and 15 rebounds.
LaMelo Ball had 31 points and 12 assists.
Garland kicked it out to Jerome for a 3-pointer — and his 12th assist — from the corner with 2:45 left.
Post-Match Reflections: First-year coach Kenny Atkinson emphasized the importance of resting Donovan Mitchell for bigger games ahead.
The Cavaliers' winning streak is allowing Atkinson to further develop his bench.
Miscellaneous Highlights: LaMelo Ball was fined $100,000 by the NBA for making an offensive and derogatory comment during an interview following Saturday’s win at Milwaukee.
